|vendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |device_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subvendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subdevice_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |id_string = <!-- PnP ID string --> |windosid = <!-- Windows ID, Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = AMBJN7, AMB-JN7 |icid = <!-- Industry Canada ID, Leave blank for none --> |boardid = <!-- Board ID --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id --> |oui = <!-- OUI -->
|chip1 = Ralink;RT3070; |chip2 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->

}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== "PEN-RT3070-QFN-V24RC-A", "11n 150M USB PEN Solution", the '''Ralink''' logo, and "RT3070 MV8.0" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
The FCC test report notes covered models as the JN7, NWC2, NW610, NW614, NWA2, NWB2, NW617, NW618, and NWD2. :They are noted as electronically identical - ''only with a different color and model name different''. :The manufacturer is noted as '''HK YUNLINK TECHNOLOGY LTD'''. ::[http://www.hkent.biz/1881802.html Hongkong Yunlink Technology Limited], est. 26 March 2013, Categorized as: '''Local Limited Trading Company'''
The FCC manual is... *describing the device it covers as the '''NextG''' ''High Power USB WiFi Adapter'' *copyright '''Datacom Network Ltd.''' ([http://danets.com/ '''danets''']) *has DN-WLAN-028 at the bottom of each page
==Links of Interest== [http://store.bearextender.com/products/bearextender-1200-for-mac On the '''BearExtender''' Store]
[[Category:English Documentation]]
